text: The 1980 World Karate Championships was the fifth edition of the World Karate Championships, and was held in Madrid, Spain in October 1980. It was the first tournament where women could participate but only in kata. ==Medalists== ===Men=== {| |- | rowspan=2|Individual kata | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |- | rowspan=2|Kumite −60 kg | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |- | rowspan=2|Kumite −65 kg | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |- | rowspan=2|Kumite −70 kg | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |- | rowspan=2|Kumite −75 kg | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |- | rowspan=2|Kumite −80 kg | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |- | rowspan=2|Kumite +80 kg | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |- | rowspan=2|Kumite open | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |- | rowspan=2|Team kumite | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |} ===Women=== {| |- | rowspan=2|Individual kata | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | |- | |} ==Medal table== ==References== ==External links== * World Karate Federation * Results World Championships World Karate Championships Category:World Karate Championships Category:International sports competitions hosted by Spain Karate Championships Category:1980s in Madrid Category:Karate competitions in Spain Category:November 1980 sports events in Europe
